thread.title: Wayne Rooney to China may depend on Man Utd's EFL Cup final | Metro News
thread.title_full: Wayne Rooney to China may depend on Man Utd's EFL Cup final | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Wayne Rooney to China may depend on Man Utd's EFL Cup final | Metro News
text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 8:31 am Wayne Rooney was back in training yesterday (Getty) 
Jose Mourinho’s decision on whether to include Wayne Rooney in his plans for Sunday’s EFL Cup final could prove the tipping point in the striker’s future. 
Manchester United ’s leading all-time scorer is being strongly linked with a move to China, where the transfer window remains open until the end of this month. It means it’s possible the 31-year-old could leave Old Trafford within days. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
But having missed the last few games due to injury, Rooney has returned to training and is available for Sunday’s trip to Wembley to face Southampton. Whether he has a role to play in the final could make up his mind on whether to remain at the club. 
Mourinho has refused to rule out the possibility of Rooney leaving over the next few days. 
‘You’ll have to ask him. I can’t guarantee that I am here next week, how can I guarantee that a player is here next season? 
‘If Wayne does leave, it is not because I want him to leave, that is all I can guarantee. 
‘I will never try and push a legend of this club to another destiny.’ Rooney with Mourinho (Getty) 
It’s also been reported that Manchester United executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward is happy for Rooney to leave the club immediately should he so desire. Wayne Rooney – Manchester United and England legend 
250 goals – Manchester United’s all-time leading scorer 
53 England goals – most in national team’s history 
5 Premier League title
